intro: Chrysophyllum disaco, commonly known as the African star apple, is a tropical evergreen tree native to West Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The tree produces edible, star-shaped fruits with a sweet, juicy pulp and a single large seed. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ornamental and culinary purposes. The plant thrives in humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
